intro: Foetidia rubescens, commonly known as the red-stemmed foetidia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, reddish stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically opposite and elliptical, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Foetidia rubescens is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
